content: snowman potholder designed by jessie mckitrick copyright 2008 my aunt is very fond of snowmen and i wanted to make something practical but cute for her for christmas after playing around with a few ideas it finally occurred to me that i could simply use the snowman s head as the potholder itself and i was pleased to see this fellow s big grin when i fastened off the last stitch this pattern creates two circles which are joined together in a double-thickness to form a 20 cm diameter round potholder materials bernat handicrafter cotton white 2 skeins note the pattern uses very little of the second skein this yarn is worsted weight 73 metres and 50 g per skein bernat handicrafter cotton orange 1 skein note i couldn t find orange cotton so i used a variegated skein and cut and restarted it whenever it became white or yellow i hope others will either find orange cotton or consider dying a few metres of the white to save a lot of hassle filati fantasia carezza black cotton 1 skein a few metres 4 25 crochet hook or as appropriate for the yarn you are using gauge as long as the stitches are tight enough to make a fairly stiff fabric but not so tight as to cause difficulties when forming the stitches you should be fine abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet w white o orange b black notes following the pattern too rigidly in spacing the increases may result in a pronounced hexagonal shape rather than round if this is happening then you may wish to vary the placement of increases over the last two or three rounds which i find rounds out the shape nicely for instance 1 single_crochet in first four stitches 2 in next *1sc in first fourteen stitches 2 in next* until last 10 put 1 single_crochet in each of these 96 single_crochet i found that i had to keep checking my work on the front to make sure that the colour changes hadn t distracted me from making increases so if something seems a bit off it s worth doing a quick count of the stitches pattern back 1 using magic loop method1 and the white cotton make 6 single_crochet do not join work proceeds in spiral place a stitch marker to keep track of where the round begins and ends 2 2 single_crochet in each stitch 12 single_crochet 3 *1sc in first stitch 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 18 single_crochet 4 *1sc in first two stitches 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 24 single_crochet 5 *1sc in first three stitches 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 30 single_crochet 6 *1sc in first four stitches 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 36 single_crochet 7 *1sc in first five stitches 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 42 single_crochet 8 *1sc in first six stitches 2 in next* repeat for remainder of round 48 single_crochet
